title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Houston Rockets defeated the Boston Celtics 128-101, ending Boston's three-game winning streak.
Kevin Durant scored 26 points, leading the Rockets who made 65.5% of their 3-pointers against the Celtics.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, excelling defensively and offensively during the game.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate running back D'Ernest Johnson to 53-man roster for Sunday's game against the Falcons.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, joins TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings in Patriots' backfield.
Patriots' depth affected by injuries, with Rhamondre Stevenson out and Antonio Gibson's season-ending ACL injury.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy's new defense partner, Nikita Zadorov, has bolstered the Bruins' defensive unit after a rocky start.
In three consecutive wins, the Zadorov-McAvoy pairing excelled, allowing just one 5-on-5 goal during 73:24 minutes together.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Jonathan Aspirot’s solid play contributed to the Bruins' improved defensive performance.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman stopped 27 of 28 shots in Bruins' 2-1 win over the Carolina Hurricanes.
Boston coach Marco Sturm started Joonas Korpisalo in consecutive games after Swayman's 7-2 loss to Ottawa.
Swayman holds a .896 save percentage this season, compared to Joonas Korpisalo's .882.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox set for the offseason with payroll space before hitting luxury tax, targeting top free agents and possible trades.
Free agents from the Red Sox include Rob Refsnyder, Dustin May, Steven Matz, Justin Wilson, and possibly Alex Bregman.
Red Sox may pursue upgrades at first and second base, while also considering trade options for outfield logjam and pitching needs.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty to call his third Patriots game this season for CBS, after previous calls against Dolphins and Titans.
Patriots hold a 6-2 record; QB Drake Maye is considered an MVP candidate for his impressive performances.
McCourty praises Maye's playmaking, noting his standout performances and effective collaboration with offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly interested in trading for Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips before Tuesday's NFL trade deadline.
Phillips has recorded 32 pressures and three sacks this season, ranking high in both pass-rush and run-stop win rates.
The Dolphins are considering trading players after falling to 2-7 and parting with their general manager last week.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei has been scratched for the third consecutive game, missing Saturday's match against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm believes Lohrei should channel his frustration constructively after being sidelined since Hampus Lindholm's return.
Lohrei's struggles in the defensive zone contrast with his offensive potential, prompting lineup changes favoring Nikita Zadorov.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 3-4 record, aiming for a playoff run.
Falcons quarterback Michael Penix has struggled in outdoor and cold environments, with a 0-3 record at outdoor stadiums.
Falcons' strong defense ranks second in yards allowed per game, with standout performances from cornerback A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, helping the Dodgers secure a 3-1 victory in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez made a crucial double play in the ninth inning, preventing a Blue Jays comeback.
The Los Angeles Dodgers forced a deciding Game 7 against the Toronto Blue Jays in the World Series.
